name: Research
section_name: Learn about Denmark research and records.

choices.name: Get started with Danish research.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Use Danish Research: Getting Started to help you with beginning Danish research.
  2. Archives.com: Get an overview of Danish family history on the Archives.com site.

    ☆ AR—Danish Family History

  3. Tips: Explore Tips for Beginners on the FamilySearch Wiki.
  4. Basics: Learn the basics of Danish and Scandinavian research in these blog articles.

    ☆ FS—Beginning Your Scandinavian Family History - 2016
    ☆ FS—Keys to Scandinavian Research - 2016

  5. Resources: Find Danish resources for research on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Danish Resources on FamilySearch.org—40:44

  6. Record Finder: Use the Denmark Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Denmark Record Finder

Locations
  1. Counties: Use the clickable Denmark counties map on the FamilySearch Wiki page to explore research locations. See also the county list below it.
  2. Copenhagen: Learn how to do research in Copenhagen, Denmark.

    ☆ FS—Research in Copenhagen—63:08 - 2016

  3. Danish Places: Learn how to sort out Danish places in your research.

    ☆ BYU—Beginning Danish Research—56:44 - 2017

content.text:
1. Explore the web links on the Strategies for Danish Research Wiki page.
  2. Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.
  3. Explore the Museum of Danish Americans for a variety of resources for your research.
  4. Explore a variety of Danish genealogy resources on the Aurelia Clemons genealogy page.

name: Census Records
section_name: Learn to use Danish census and civil registration records.

hidden.content:

content.text:

    • Online Census Extractions

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Danish research.

content.text:
1. Explore links in the FamilySearch Wiki.
  2. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for Denmark.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the FamilySearch page for Danish online record collections.
  4. Explore the Europe page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Danish research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Danish American Genealogy Group on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Danish Genealogy Group on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆Northern Europe Research Facebook page for FamilySearch.
  4. Visit the ☆Danish FamilySearch page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the ☆Danmark Slægtsforskning page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Denmark.

choices.name: Join a mailing list, community, or message board for Denmark research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for Danish (Nordic Countries) research.
  2. Explore the ☆Denmark research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Denmark research.
  4. Explore Denmark research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

choices.name: Learn about Denmark genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about Denmark genealogy societies in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Denmark Societies

  2. Explore ☆Denmark genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  3. Get help at a family history center in Denmark.
